page.title: 14RELIGION
page.content: The church of{St John's}was situated halfway between{Moss and Fenwick.}It was built in the 1870's. It was demolished in 1980 but the graueyard is still used today. There is a Methodist{chapel}in{Fenwick.}It was built in 1896. This chapel is now shared by the Church of England and the Methodists. The{stained glass windows from the church have been put into the chapel. It is only a small two roomed building. The{church hall built in 1928 near St John's is still used today as a meeting place for the people of Moss amd Fenwick.
